item.title: Hargrove add a quote by Fran Lebowitz
item.description: "The opposite of talking isn't listening. The opposite of talking is waiting." -- Fran Lebowitz

item.title: Hargrove add a quote by Fran Lebowitz
item.description: "All God's children are not beautiful. Most of God's children are, in fact, barely presentable." -- Fran Lebowitz

item.title: Hargrove add a quote by Fran Lebowitz
item.description: "If you are of the opinion that the contemplation of suicide is sufficient evidence of a poetic nature, do not forget that actions speak louder than words." -- Fran Lebowitz

item.title: Hargrove add a quote by Fran Lebowitz
item.description: "I figure you have the same chance of winning the lottery whether you play or not." -- Fran Lebowitz

item.title: Hargrove add a quote by Fran Lebowitz
item.description: "When Toni Morrison said 'write the book you want to read,' she didn't mean everybody." -- Fran Lebowitz

item.title: Hargrove add a quote by Alfred Lord Tennyson
item.description: "Hope Smiles from the threshold of the year to come, Whispering 'it will be happier'..." -- Alfred Lord Tennyson

item.title: Hargrove add a quote by Tibor Kalman
item.description: "The perfect state of creative bliss is having power (you are 50) and knowing nothing (you are 9). This assures an interesting and successful outcome." -- Tibor Kalman

item.title: Hargrove add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "If I didn't care for fun and such, I'd probably amount to much. But I shall stay the way I am, Because I do not give a damn." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Hargrove add a quote by Dorothy B. Hughes
item.description: "I was born when you kissed me. I died when you left me. I lived a few weeks while you loved me." -- Dorothy B. Hughes

item.title: Hargrove add a quote by Dorothy B. Hughes
item.description: "Itâ€™s harder to come back than it is to arrive." -- Dorothy B. Hughes

item.title: Hargrove add a quote by Peter Ackroyd
item.description: "And when I was young, did I ever tell you, I always wanted to get inside a book and never come out again? I loved reading so much I wanted to be a part of it, and there were some books I could have stayed in for ever." -- Peter Ackroyd
